transcript:
Agent: Thank you for calling. How may I help you today?

Customer: Hi, I'm thinking about upgrading my plan but I want to understand the differences between the Premium and Business tiers.

Agent: I'd be happy to explain the differences. The Premium plan at $29/month includes unlimited storage, priority support, and up to 10 team members. The Business plan at $49/month includes everything in Premium plus advanced analytics, API access, and up to 50 team members. What's your primary use case?

Customer: We're a small marketing agency with about 8 people right now, but we're planning to hire 5 more people in the next quarter. We definitely need the analytics.

Agent: Based on that, I'd recommend the Business plan. With your growth plans, you'll exceed the 10-user limit on Premium soon, and the advanced analytics seem important for your work. Plus, the API access could be valuable for integrating with your other tools.

Customer: That makes sense. Can I switch plans mid-month or do I need to wait?

Agent: You can switch anytime. We'll prorate your current plan and you'll only pay the difference for the remainder of this billing cycle.

Customer: Perfect. Let me discuss with my team and we'll call back to upgrade.

Agent: Sounds good! When you're ready, just call us or you can upgrade directly through your account settings online. Anything else I can help with?

Customer: No, that's very helpful. Thank you!
golden_summary: Customer inquired about differences between Premium ($29/month, 10 users, unlimited storage, priority support) and Business plans ($49/month, 50 users, includes analytics and API access). Customer is small marketing agency with 8 employees planning to hire 5 more. Agent recommended Business plan based on growth trajectory and analytics needs. Customer will discuss with team before upgrading. Agent noted prorated billing available for mid-cycle plan changes.

key_points: Comparing Premium vs Business plan features
Customer will discuss with team before deciding
